alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 5:15AM MDT until May 29 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong southwest winds combined with above normal warmth, and an extremely dry and unstable airmass will lead to widespread critical to locally extreme fire weather conditions across all of northern and central New Mexico today. Overnight humidity recoveries will be poor in many areas while winds stay locally strong, allowing localized elevated to critical fire weather conditions to persist tonight and again Sunday evening. Strong winds will return Memorial Day over eastern and southern New Mexico while temperatures will be cooler over the west. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest and West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, North Central and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, Northeast Highlands, Northeast and East Central Plains from 9 AM to 10 PM MDT today and from 11 AM and 9 PM Monday morning through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to between 40 and 50 mph today and Memorial Day. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity will fall to between 6 and 15 percent today and Memorial Day. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
